intro: Launaea nudicaulis var. nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed launaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, leafless stems that often appear bare, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
